p:
We assume that once viral suppression is obtained that persons remain suppressed ( y = 0), and that the rate at which PrEP is stopped is
x =
1
12
in the “1-year PrEP” parameter set and x = 0 in the “Unlimited PrEP” case. That is we assume that persons are fully compliant with both TasP and PrEP and that PrEP ends only when a high-risk interval ends or PrEP runs out.
